Articles.Content: Apollo 1's Crew laying around after practicing a water landing. Never thought i'd see such a picture.
Hey those had to be properly tested, if they landed off target they could have been stuck in them for hours.
They had to practice doing it unassisted in case they came down somewhere recovery forces weren't.
All they need are a few mojitos. Did the crew provisions on the Apollo missions include any rum?
That era looks like the best time to live.... People dressed nice, and you had a space program that actually did something!

That era looks like the best time to live.... People dressed nice, and you had a space program that actually did something!

Not to mention the cars.
Shame they died in such a horrible day.

R.I.P. Apollo 1, crew of two of NASA's most game-changing astronauts Ed White, Gus Grissom, and rookie Roger Chaffee.

Ed White completed america's very first spacewalk (there's some great footage of it) and Gus was NASA's most experienced astronaut up until that point, going in both the Mercury capsules and flying the Gemini pods as well.

R.I.P. Apollo 1, crew of two of NASA's most game-changing astronauts Ed White, Gus Grissom, and rookie Roger Chaffee.

Ed White completed america's very first spacewalk (there's some great footage of it) and Gus was NASA's most experienced astronaut up until that point, going in both the Mercury capsules and flying the Gemini pods as well.

Yes a very very sad day :(

That era looks like the best time to live.... People dressed nice, and you had a space program that actually did something!

Best time to live, assuming you weren't anything other than a heterosexual middle or upper class white male. Most other people, a little less pleasant. (Just saying.)
